intro: Langloisia setosissima var. campyloclados, commonly known as the hairy langloisia, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a unique tactile appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to orange. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
